articles.title: Ghostly Deep Sea Fish Surprises Scientists Again—It Can Live for 100 Years
articles.description: A team of French researchers has found that the little-understood coelacanth can live for a century. Not only that, but the fish’s whole lifespan appears to be stretched, as it spends years in the womb and doesn’t fully mature until at least age 45. Read more…

articles.title: Aliens Wouldn't Need Warp Drives to Take Over an Entire Galaxy, Simulation Suggests
articles.description: A new computer simulation shows that a technologically advanced civilization, even when using slow ships, can still colonize an entire galaxy in a modest amount of time. The finding presents a possible model for interstellar migration and a sharpened sense of…

A clip of the new visualization. White dots are unsettled stars, magenta spheres are settled stars, and white cubes are starships in transit.

articles.title: Newly Discovered Giant Rhino Fossil Defies the Imagination
articles.description: Giant rhinos are among the largest mammals to have ever walked this great Earth, and a newly discovered species that lived in northwest China some 25 million years ago is revealing just how magnificent these creatures were. Read more...

articles.title: Mirrors That Detect Ripples in Space-Time Were Frozen to Near Absolute Zero
articles.description: A team of physicists say they’ve managed to nearly freeze the motion of atoms across four suspended mirrors. It’s a mind-twisting feat that strains the very definitions of seemingly simple words like “object” and “temperature.” So buckle up.Read more...
